str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To leap upon, assault. From epi and hallomai; to spring upon.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To exercise authority over, overpower, master. From kata and kurieuo; to lord against, i.e. Control, subjugate.
Both (of two). Comparative of amphi; both.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
To flee out, away, escape; with an acc: I escape something. From ek and pheugo; to flee out.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
Rarely: stark-naked; generally: wearing only the under-garment; bare, open, manifest; mere. Of uncertain affinity; nude.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To wound. From trauma; to inflict a wound.
